summary: This document is a chain of email correspondence between prosecutors and defense attorneys regarding the scheduling of meetings and calls, and the identification of a trial witness from JPMorgan in the case United States v. Ghislaine Maxwell. It reveals coordination between legal teams during the pre-trial and jury selection phase.

persons.name: Allison Stoddart
persons.context: Attorney from WilmerHale representing or involved in the defense side, coordinating scheduling and witness matters with the prosecution.

persons.name: Anjan Sahni
persons.context: Prosecutor from the Southern District of New York handling the Ghislaine Maxwell case, copied on correspondence about scheduling and witness identification.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: The accused in the criminal case United States v. Ghislaine Maxwell, referenced in the subject line of all emails.

connections.description: Defense attorney and prosecutor communicating to coordinate scheduling and discuss trial witness matters.
Stoddart is an attorney involved in the defense of Ghislaine Maxwell, as indicated by her coordination on the case.
Sahni is the prosecutor bringing the case against defendant Ghislaine Maxwell.

events.title: Scheduled Call
events.description: A call is scheduled for 7 p.m. between legal teams, with one party heading to court for jury selection.

events.title: Travel Return
events.description: Mention that 'IM' (likely a person, possibly a colleague or client) has been traveling and is returning, affecting scheduling.

events.title: Witness Identification Discussion
events.description: Prosecution sends documents to facilitate conversation about identifying an appropriate trial witness from JPMorgan.

keyFacts: The correspondence is between defense attorney Allison Stoddart of WilmerHale and prosecutor Anjan Sahni regarding the Ghislaine Maxwell trial.
The prosecution is seeking to identify and subpoena a witness from JPMorgan to testify at trial.
Jury selection was underway or scheduled for the week of November 15, 2021, creating scheduling difficulties.
The emails show ongoing coordination and scheduling challenges between the legal teams in the lead-up to trial.
